titles.title: Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” / Mäṣḥafä lǝdätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Genealogy of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” / Mäṣḥafä fǝlsätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Translation of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” / Täʾamrä Täklä Haymanot “Miracles of Täklä Haymanot”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 4ra-7ra) II) Mäṣḥafä lǝdätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Genealogy of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 7ra-8va) - Genealogy of Täklä Haymanot (fols. 7ra-8va) III) Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 8va-110ra) - Introduction (fols. 8va-13rb) - Gädlä Täklä Haymanot “Vita of Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 13rb-110ra) IV) Mäṣḥafä fǝlsätu lä-ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot “Book of the Translation of ʾabunä Täklä Haymanot” (fols. 110ra-120ra) V) Täʾamrä Täklä Haymanot “Miracles of Täklä Haymanot”: 19 miracles (fols. 120rb-131rb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: ʾato Bayru Wäldä Lǝʿul (s. Additio 1; s. supplication formulas fols. 108ra, 110ra, 123rb, 126ra). Besides, other individuals are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Gäbrä Ṥәllase most frequently (fols. 10ra, 13ra, 52va, 58rb, 60rb, 69vb, 79ra, 89rb, 99ra, 105va, 108ra, 110ra, 110vb, 120ra, 120rb, 121ra), his mother Ḫirutä Ṥәllase (fols. 110ra, 123rb, 126va); others, possibly members of his family: Wälättä Ṣadәqan (fols. 10ra, 52va, 79ra, 89rb, 130va), Gäbrä ʾArägawi (fols. 10ra, 52va, 79ra, 99ra, 120ra), Wälättä Krәstos (fols. 10ra, 60rb, 89rb, 110vb, 120ra), Gäbrä Tәnśʾe (fols. 10ra, 120ra, 121vb, 124ra, 125ra), Wälättä Kidan (fols. 10ra, 52va, 99ra, 110vb, 120ra), Gäbrä Ṣadәqan (fols. 58rb, 122ra, 124va, 125ra), Wälättä Yoḥannәs (fols. 108ra, 120ra), Gäbrä Maryam (fols. 108ra, 126va, 130ra), Gäbrä Krәstos (fols. 124ra, 124va, 126ra, 127rb, 128rb), Wälättä Wahәd (fols. 124vb, 129rb, 130ra, 130va).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

txfolios.txfolio: Number 61 is given to two fols (61, 61a).

squires.squire: A(3; s.l. 1, stub after 3/fols. 1r-3v) – I(8/fols. 4r-11v) – II(8/fols. 12r-19v) – III(8/fols. 20r-27v) – IV(8/fols. 28r-35v) – V(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VI(8/fols. 44r-51v) – VII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – VIII(8/fols. 60r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8; s.l. 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(8/fols. 107r-114v) – XV(8/fols. 115r-122v) – XVI(8/fols. 123r-132v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; names of the donors; incipit of Texts I and III, and its subsections (fols. 13ra, 18ra, 19va, 39ra, 40va, 41va, 41vb, 43va, 47rb, 51va, 53va, 58rb, 59vb, 60ra, 69vb, 105va, 108ra, 110ra, 111ra); incipit of Text II; incipit of Text IV; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. In the incipit page of Texts I, III, IV (fols. 4r, 8v, 120r), a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The text of the Vita has some characteristics of the so-called "Ḥayq recension" of Gädlä Täklä Haymanot. Cp. Mss. EMML no. 1834 (EMML V, 310-14); BN, Éth. 342 (GrébGriaule II, 18-20), Ṭānāsee 162 (SixTana III, 202-06). For a (rough) French translation of the text s. J. DUCHESNE-FOURNET, Mission en Éthiopie, 1901-1903, vol. 1, Paris 1908, 340-431.
